contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=February 2012}} {{DISPLAYTITLE:Harbinger (''Star Trek: Enterprise'')}} {{Infobox television episode | Title = Harbinger | Image = | Caption = | Series = [[Star Trek: Enterprise]] | Season = 3 | Episode = 15 | Production = 315 | Airdate = {{Startdate|2004|02|11}} | Story = [[Rick Berman]]<br/>[[Brannon Braga]] | Teleplay = [[Manny Coto]] | Director = [[David Livingston]] | Music = [[Velton Ray Bunch]] | Guests = *[[Noa Tishby]] - Amanda Cole *[[Thomas Kopache]] - The Alien *[[Steven Culp]] - [[Major Hayes]] | Prev = [[Stratagem (Star Trek: Enterprise)|Stratagem]] | Next = [[Doctor's Orders]] | Episode list = [[List of Star Trek: Enterprise episodes|List of ''Star Trek: Enterprise'' episodes]] }} __NOTOC__ '''"Harbinger"''' is the 67th [[episode]] of ''[[Star Trek: Enterprise]]'', the 15th episode from the [[Star_Trek:_Enterprise#Season_3|third season]]. ==Plot== {{Expand section|date=February 2012}} This episode balances three plotlines. In the main story, Captain [[Jonathan Archer|Archer]] investigates the appearance of an alien pilot ([[Thomas Kopache]]) at the site of a spatial anomaly. Unknown to the crew, this alien is one of the [[Sphere Builder]]s who will become prominent in later episodes. In a secondary story, the long-simmering anger between Lt. [[Malcolm Reed]] and Major [[Major Hayes|Hayes]] finally comes to a head when they get into a physical fight over their competing roles aboard ''Enterprise''. Lastly, Sub-commander [[T'Pol]] experiences unexpected jealousy when Commander [[Charles Tucker III|Tucker]] begins displaying an attraction to a female MACO, which leads to an emotional confrontation with results that leave both parties surprised and uncomfortable. ==Notes== * The episode was intended as a "breather" episode between major sections of the [[Xindi (Star Trek)|Xindi]] arc and is noted for introducing a sexual relationship between the characters of Tucker and T'Pol: ** A later episode, "[[Damage (Star Trek: Enterprise)|Damage]]," would explain T'Pol's un-[[Vulcan (Star Trek)|Vulcan]]-like behavior in this and other episodes, ** The fourth season episode "[[Home (Star Trek: Enterprise)|Home]]" would further explore the relationship between Tucker and T'Pol, and ** The fourth season episode "[[Bound (Star Trek: Enterprise)|Bound]]" would reveal that their single encounter had had an unexpected side-effect - a telepathic bond. ==External links== *{{IMDb title|id=0572214|title=Harbinger}} *{{tv.com episode|star-trek-enterprise/harbinger-286768|Harbinger}} *{{memoryalpha|Harbinger (episode)|Harbinger}} *{{StarTrek.com link|ENT|3852|Harbinger}} {{Star Trek Vulcan stories}} {{Star Trek ENT S3}} {{Star Trek ENT}} {{Star Trek}} [[Category:Star Trek: Enterprise episodes]] [[Category:2004 television episodes]] {{StarTrek-Enterprise-episode-stub}}
